With the cooler weather upon us, we are seeing an increase in the number of students sick. Many are complaining of headache, sore throat, body aches, nasal congestion, cough, nausea and fever. All of these are classic symptoms of the flu. At the moment, there are three confirmed cases of Pneumonia, one confirmed case of RSV, and five confirmed cases of the flu district wide. Although our confirmed cases are minimal, there are still many viruses being seen in the schools.
If your child is sick, please keep them home. If they have a temperature of 100 or more, please keep them home. District guidelines are a student must be fever free for 24 hours without medication. If your child is vomiting or has the diarrhea, they must stay home.
We work hard daily to create a healthy environment for our students and staff. Thank you for your part in helping us. Remember hand washing is your best defense.

Kountze ISD missed school due to inclement weather (ice) on the 16th and 17th of Jan. 2018. Therefore, students will need to make up the instructional time required by the Texas Education Agency. KISD will add a few “extra” minutes to the front of our daily schedule starting on Jan. 29, 2018. Our first bell will ring at 7:36 am and school will be dismissed at the regular time. By adding this make up time at the start of each day, KISD will not need to add any make up days to the calendar, and no changes will be made to the holidays, grading cycles, or the last day of school, which will remain 31 May 2018.

Should you have any questions please feel free to contact your campus principals.
